comments:
Hi

With a very small project suddenly I received this error.
The last thing I did was to throw away a class.
Even a clean does not change something.

After restarting eclipse the error is gone.

tschuess
Thomas

Environment:
Eclipse
Version: 3.1.1
Build id: M20050929-0840

WinXP

Java
java version "1.5.0_06"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-b05, mixed mode, sharing)


java.lang.RuntimeException
at org.aspectj.weaver.WeaverStateInfo.read(WeaverStateInfo.java:142)
at org.aspectj.weaver.AjAttribute.read(AjAttribute.java:98)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelAttributes.readAjAttributes(BcelAttributes.java:59)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelObjectType.unpackAspectAttributes(BcelObjectType.java:273)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelObjectType.<init>(BcelObjectType.java:134)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWorld.makeBcelObjectType(BcelWorld.java:257)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWorld.addSourceObjectType(BcelWorld.java:314)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWeaver.addIfAspect(BcelWeaver.java:256)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWeaver.addAspectsFromDirectory(BcelWeaver.java:248)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWeaver.addLibraryJarFile(BcelWeaver.java:198)
at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.initBcelWorld(AjBuildManager.java:623)
at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.doBuild(AjBuildManager.java:209)
at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.batchBuild(AjBuildManager.java:156)
at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.compile(CompilerAdapter.java:122)
at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.run(AspectJBuildManager.java:191)

RuntimeException thrown: bad WeaverState.Kind: -115

Hmmm - that indicates AspectJ has encountered an mal-formed attribute or an attribute built by a different version of AspectJ which it doesn't understand.

What version of AJDT are you using inside Eclipse?
Do you have any libraries configured on the inpath or aspectpath for your project or any libraries on your classpath that contain AspectJ code?

Hi

I use this version:

Eclipse AspectJ Development Tools

Version: 1.3.0
Build id: 20051220093604
AspectJ version: 1.5.0

On my build path are these jars:
fitlibrary.jar
fitness.jar
log4j-1.2.13.jar

And I think they do not use AspectJ.

And so far I am not able to reproduce the error.

tschuess
Thomas

Andy suspected a configuration error and Thomas has not been able to reproduce, so I'm closing as UTR.
stalebug
